maml:description.maml:para: Disables a VLAN of a network switch.
The Disable-NetworkSwitchVlan cmdlet disables a virtual local area network (VLAN) of a network switch.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the instance ID of a VLAN to disable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the name of a VLAN to disable. This ElementName is a friendly name. It is not necessarily unique.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies VLAN ID of the VLAN to disable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the instance ID of a VLAN to disable.
Specifies the name of a VLAN to disable. This ElementName is a friendly name. It is not necessarily unique.
Specifies VLAN ID of the VLAN to disable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: ------ Example 1: Disable a VLAN by using an instance ID ------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Disable-NetworkSwitchVlan -InstanceID "Vlan02" -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
The second command disables the VLAN that has the instance ID Vlan02 for the switch NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- Example 2: Disable a VLAN by using a name ----------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command disables the VLAN named VLAN22. The command includes a CimSession , similar to the first example.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- Example 3: Disable a VLAN by using its ID ----------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command disables the VLAN that has the VLAN ID 74. The command includes a CimSession , similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Enables a VLAN for a network switch.
The Enable-NetworkSwitchVlan cmdlet enables a virtual local area network (VLAN) for a network switch.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the instance ID of a VLAN to remove.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the name of a VLAN to enable. This ElementName is a friendly name. It is not necessarily unique.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies VLAN ID of the VLAN to enable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the instance ID of a VLAN to remove.
Specifies the name of a VLAN to enable. This ElementName is a friendly name. It is not necessarily unique.
Specifies VLAN ID of the VLAN to enable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: ------- Example 1: Enable a VLAN by using an instance ID -------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Enable-NetworkSwitchVlan -InstanceID "Vlan02" -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
The second command enables the VLAN that has the instance ID Vlan02 for the switch NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: ----------- Example 2: Enable a VLAN by using a name -----------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command enables the VLAN named VLAN22. The command includes a CimSession , similar to the first example.

command:example.maml:title: ----------- Example 3: Enable a VLAN by using its ID -----------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command enables the VLAN that has the VLAN ID 74. The command includes a CimSession , similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets VLANs for a network switch.
The Get-NetworkSwitchVlan cmdlet gets available virtual local area networks (VLANs) for a network switch.
Specifies the caption of a VLAN to get.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Specifies the description of a VLAN to get.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Specifies the instance ID of a VLAN to get.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Specifies the name of a VLAN to get. This ElementName is a friendly name. It is not necessarily unique.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Specifies the VLAN ID of the VLAN to get.
Specifies the caption of a VLAN to get.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Specifies the description of a VLAN to get.
Specifies the instance ID of a VLAN to get.
Specifies the name of a VLAN to get. This ElementName is a friendly name. It is not necessarily unique.
Specifies the VLAN ID of the VLAN to get.

command:example.maml:title: -------- Example 1: Get all VLANs for a network switch --------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Get-NetworkSwitchVlan -CimSession $Session Caption Description Name InstanceID VlanID PSComputerName ------- ----------- ----------- ---------- ------ -------------- Vlan_description default Contoso:NetworkVL... 1 10.19.246.18 Vlan_description VLAN0002 Contoso:NetworkVL... 2 10.19.246.18

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
The second command gets all VLAN for the switch NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: ------------ Example 2: Get a VLAN by using a name ------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-NetworkSwitchVlan -CimSession $Session -Name "VLAN22" Caption Description Name InstanceID VlanID PSComputerName ------- ----------- ----------- ---------- ------ -------------- Vlan_description VLAN22 Contoso:NetworkVL... 1 10.19.236.49

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the VLAN named VLAN22. The command includes a CimSession , similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a VLAN for a network switch.
The New-NetworkSwitchVlan cmdlet creates a virtual local area network (VLAN) for a network switch.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Specifies a caption for the new VLAN.
Specifies a description of the new VLAN.
Specifies a VLAN ID for the new VLAN.
Specifies a name to use as the VLAN ElementName . This is a friendly name.
Specifies a caption for the new VLAN.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Specifies a description of the new VLAN.
Specifies a name to use as the VLAN ElementName . This is a friendly name.
Specifies a VLAN ID for the new VLAN.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------- Example 1: Create a VLAN -------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> New-NetworkSwitchVlan -Name "Contoso07VLAN" -Caption "VLAN 07" -CimSession $Session Caption Description ElementName InstanceID VlanID PSComputerName ------- ----------- ----------- ---------- ------ -------------- VLAN 07 VLAN0004 Contoso:NetworkVL... 4 10.19.26.4

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
The second creates a VLAN for the switch NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes network switch VLANs.
The Remove-NetworkSwitchVlan cmdlet removes virtual local area networks (VLANs) from a network switch.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the instance ID of a VLAN to remove.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a name for a VLAN to remove. You can use wildcard characters to select multiple VLANs to remove.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the ID of a VLAN to remove.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies the instance ID of a VLAN to remove.
Specifies a name for a VLAN to remove. You can use wildcard characters to select multiple VLANs to remove.
Specifies the ID of a VLAN to remove.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects that correspond to network switch VLANs to this cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: ------- Example 1: Remove a VLAN that has a specified ID -------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Remove-NetworkSwitchVlan -CimSession $Session -VlanID 2

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
The second command removes the VLAN that has a VLAN ID of 2 for the switch NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: ----- Example 2: Remove a VLAN for a specified instance ID -----

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the VLAN for the specified instance ID. The command includes a CimSession , similar to the first example.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Remove VLANs that have names that contain a string

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes all VLANs that have friendly names that include the string Contoso. The command includes a CimSession , similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies properties on a VLAN on a network switch.
The Set-NetworkSwitchVlanProperty cmdlet modifies settable properties on a virtual local area network (VLAN) on a network switch.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies a hash table of name/value pairs. The cmdlet sets the properties that this parameter specifies.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a hash table of name/value pairs. The cmdlet sets the properties that this parameter specifies.
Specifies an array of VLAN IDs of VLANs to modify.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies a hash table of name/value pairs. The cmdlet sets the properties that this parameter specifies.
Specifies an array of VLAN IDs of VLANs to modify.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects that represent VLANs to this cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: ------------- Example 1: Set properties for a VLAN -------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> $VlanName = "Contoso VLAN 07" PS C:\> $Description = "This VLAN is used to create a virtual Contoso company LAN" PS C:\> Set-NetworkSwitchVlanProperty -VlanId 12 -Property @{ElementName = $VlanName; Description = $Description} -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
The second and third commands assign values to the $VlanName variable and the $Description variable. These are the values of the key/value pairs.

The final command modifies the properties of the VLAN identified by the VLAN ID 5 to include the name/value pairs specified by the Property parameter. The command uses standard syntax to create a hash table that contains the name/value pairs. The command operates on the network switch named NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.
